intro: Gossia clusioides subsp. taomensis, commonly known as the Taome Mountain Gossia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Guttiferae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
